attributes.action: Turn Brexit into WExit - Wales&England Exit
attributes.additional_details:
To Leave, long Article 50 talks are required.  

A part of the UK can Leave, without having to go through long negotiations with the EU.  Any part that leaves can re-join, by negotiation.  Any part that stays does not need to re-negotiate.  

If the whole UK leaves, it cannot re-join.

The Good Friday Agreement needs both the Republic of Ireland and NI to Remain, to avoid a return to armed struggle.

Gibraltar needs to Remain to keep its border open.  

Scotland's votes since 2011 are for Remain
attributes.background:
4 jurisdictions voted.  Only 1 voted to Leave.  

Let the part that wishes to, Leave, and save it from long negotiations.  Let the other parts to Remain without long re-joining talks.   

Votes 
Leave 
E&W +4.9% 

Remain 
Gibraltar +76.7% 
Scotland +16.1% 
NI +7.2%
